abstract: The two giants also set aside a combined $22 billion to cover potentially bad debts.
snippet: The two giants also set aside a combined $22 billion to cover potentially bad debts.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  HSBC Holdings and Barclays reported improved first-half profits on Monday that were largely the result of their investment banking businesses. Yet the banks also set aside a combined $22 billion to cover potentially bad debts as recession and high unemployment led to more retail loans going sour.

headline.main: Investment Banking Aids HSBC and Barclays Profit
headline.print_headline: Investment Banking Aids HSBC and Barclays Profit
